intro: Thouinia serrata, commonly known as the serrated thouinia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Thouinia serrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
